page.title: 10WATER TOWER HOUGHTON
page.content: In 1984 the restoration of the water tower gained top prize in the TRADES of the YEAR, plastering and decorators section.The water tower was used to store 16,OOO gallons of water for domestic use at the hall until mains water was introduced. It was built to the design of the ninth EARL of PEMBROKE about 173O, in the PALLADIAN style with brick and stone cased in stucco.The project was carried out by the DOWAGER MARCHIONESS with the aid of a grant from the Department of the Environment. The tower, standing in the hall grounds, still contains 16,OOO gallons of water and may be seen from the outside by the public on the open days. There is no mains sewage at Houghton but it is dealt with privately.
